website_summaries.verdict: Despite some durability issues, most buyers like this pole for its casting and its price.
pros: Lightweight design makes it extremely portable
cons: Some buyers claim that this pole isn't as durable as other models
The segments can stick in the extended position when you try to retract them

customer_reviews.title: Nice packing rod
customer_reviews.text: My high country backpacking rod. Quick to deploy, casts well. I haven't caught anything over 14" with it yet. So there is a big one out there that will test it. I use an eagle claw trailmaster for big water fishing. 25" brown trout is the max so far.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Human

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Been stored in armrest of my car for a while. Saw some carp swimming ran and grabbed it and caught one. Pole served it’s purpose, I was impressed with this pole that was less than 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco Benkoski

customer_reviews.title: perfect for quick fishing project
customer_reviews.text: Bought this just to be able to quickly go fishing with my son: we grab 2 of these and a small tackle box and we can fish all day. It's a bit short, but the action is really nice - not too firm or too soft, but nicely flexible. It feels like it's all fiberglass. Eyes are OK, and the nut to hold on the reel hasn't come loose yet. These poles are a bit short, but we can cast really well with them. They quickly collapse and we throw them in the back of the SUV. Really nice, fully recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: A Regular Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, very sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few telescopic rods because I do not have room to store regular one-piece rods. The ability to throw this in the trunk or into a backpack make it ideal for me. As they are so cheap, I am also using these for my children to learn to fish with. I've paired these with older spin Shimano 2000 reels with the quick fire triggers (much easier for the kids to use). Works great so far, very stable and hasn't broken rod tips like the Shakespeare telescopic and 2-piece units I previously purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Laws

customer_reviews.title: Great value and gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as gift for my husband because he is forever breaking his long poles when traveling with them. This one is great for compact fishing trips. He tried it out and says it is the perfect size when extended and also says it seems pretty tough. He also says its great for knowing when you've got a bite. It arrived auper fast and was packaged great for protection. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a dependable yet affordable retractable rod. I wasn't too crazy about the yellow color but it looks good with the black and also not easily lost :)
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Daizy

customer_reviews.title: Rod is heavy and very stiff/inflexible.
customer_reviews.text: This rod weighs more than a regular rod and is so stiff as to be useless unless you are fishing for very large fish with very heavy lures. A better choice is the Shakespeare model STM66SPT telescopic 6’ 6” rod that collapses to 15”, has excellent ‘medium’ action, weighs less, and costs $15. I purchased three different travel rods simultaneously from Amazon to evaluate and this is one of the losers.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E Giles

customer_reviews.title: absolute garbage !
customer_reviews.text: it's broke in a third trip , I didn't even pull hard , my lure snagged and I was trying to get it back , the line was a 4 lb test fluorocarbon ! I have another Eagle Clow rod and it's works fine , but this one is absolute garbage ! They didn't accept return . Better spare your money and buy some cheep telescopic rod from ebay for $4-$5 , so if it's broke , you will not gonna loose that much money
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first few times I opened it
customer_reviews.text: I like Eagle Claw stuff but this thing is cheaply made, should've guessed at its cheapo price. It broke the first few times I opened it before I even got it on the water. I returned it and paid up for the Kast King telescopic.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Just like old times
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these 30 years ago, and this one is nearly identical. Exactly what I was hoping for! Fits in a backpack without removing the tackle. I recently taught my wife to fish with it, no problems or surprises. It had no trouble with a 19+" trout!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great portable rod - I use it everywhere, Freshwater, Saltwater, you name it!
customer_reviews.text: Have caught a ton of fish with this rod. It is my absolute favorite. I use it in freshwater and saltwater and use it everywhere. Have caught tons of sunfish, bass, chain pickerel, searobin, blues, and even small stripers with this rod. I use it with a penn spinning reel and 10 lb braid. One limitation is I think with longer rods, I can cast farther. But this casts well enough for my purposes. You won't regret this purchase. I know I don't.
customer_reviews.author: Edison B. Alulema

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pole for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pole for traveling. I keep it strapped to the back of my motorcycle and have used it in saltwater and fresh. I have never had a problem with it and it appears to be well made. I'm using a little more than a little reel on it with approximately six pound test. It's approximately 6 or 7 inches when closed and I've had no problems with it staying stretched open or the eyes turning. ..good little pole. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: D Nick

customer_reviews.title: This rod is great, very cheap, very portable
customer_reviews.text: I found no issues using this rod, easily put my reel on it. I tested bending it and it can handle a good amount of weight. Would recommend to anyone going hiking who wants to fish along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: If you need a telescopic rod!
customer_reviews.text: Eagle claw is a brand thats been in the fishing game for a long time. Using this rod a few times it feels quite decent! Overall feels decently sturdy and quite nice. A little on the heavier side but i guess it needs to be sturdy to be a telescopic rod.
customer_reviews.author: bwong247

customer_reviews.title: Super portable, good action, stays extended.
customer_reviews.text: update: Snapped :/ Ive taken this on several trips to the lake and some other bodies of water and i love how it packs down. Its great for motorcycle or hiking trips. I caught a snapping turtle which was scary but it held through!
customer_reviews.author: Hedorah

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea But Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but as several reviews warned, it broke after using it about eight times. The pole is fragile and I was very careful when extending or retracting it. But the guides are just glued on and when one slips off it's the beginning of the end. I bought this to take on a trip to Ireland and ended up finding a very solid and less expensive one in bait and tackle shop in the Temple Bar neighborhood of Dublin. A rod like this is perfect for me for kayak use, but I would recommend a different, more sturdy brand.
customer_reviews.author: Owenistic

customer_reviews.title: Compact fun
customer_reviews.text: When I'm not at work, I go down to my local park. I pack my guitar, a small cooking kit, and now this rod. Everything fits on my motor scooter with room for more gear. Compact and light, doesn't take up much space. My reel is a Shimano Slade 2500 with 10# line. Great bass rod, should hold up for hornpout and trout, works wonders for yellow perch. This is a definite keeper! Wish it was a heavier action.
customer_reviews.author: Craig H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product-will not collapse.
customer_reviews.text: Like many of the other low star reviews, I was disappointed to see the rod has glued on eyelets. Fist extension of the rod out of the box and the smallest extension is permanently stuck. No amount of tapping or twisting is getting it unstuck. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Shane O.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect panfish rod
customer_reviews.text: The perfect pan fishing reel. I throw it in my backpack with a cheap shimano ix reel and 8lb fluoro. I've caught so many bluegill and sunfish with this rod. It might be able to pull in a small bass too but mine isn't setup for bass so I can't really say.
customer_reviews.author: E Gahbler

customer_reviews.title: C'mon.. really?
customer_reviews.text: Snapped in half on the first cast lol. Casted into a stream. Got hung up and went to pull back the whole front just cracks in half mind you I'm only using like a 5 lb test line for trout and have the drag set to low, then I looked at the construction realize it's a cheap plastic material. Maybe I just got a cracked pole but either way. I'm a tiny bit miffed. I can prolly fix it but, cmon.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: POS. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on September 11 2019, it arrived a few days later. By today, August 13 2020, the rod is cracked and broke with almost no force upon me pushing it. Absolute garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: When it's collapsed, there's no way to secure it so it'll rattle around like crazy. I also wish it came in a color other than yellow which scares off the trout around here.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I use it in the boat and my son uses it for shoreline fishing. Works fine. Like the color so I can easily find it. Throw a cheap reel on and your good to go
customer_reviews.author: Jay556.

customer_reviews.title: Great little camp/pack rod!
customer_reviews.text: Tons of fun! Easy to pack, quite durable, and has a very pleasant, light action. I really enjoy taking this rod camping and on other miscellaneous adventures. Would buy it again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Fisher 2

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good telescopic pole. But would give it 5 stars if it came with some kind of latch or cover to keep it from telescoping out when you tilt the tip downward. Had to make my own. Come on, Is that too much to ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Cheap affordable Rod
customer_reviews.text: Strictly bought to be able to hike in and fish, we will see how it holds up. Doesn’t seem like a terrible rod. Cheaper on amazon then in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Crege Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: eagle claw telescoping spinning rod
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Have used telescoping rods for the kids and grand kids for over 30 years. This rod should last my grandson a long time. We use it many times a week and on vacation. It is easy for him to use and when it is retracted it is neat and easy to put away in my vehicle. It lifts a 14" plus bass out of the water and for a 3 year old that is a monster fish. A Countless number of sunfish have been swung over for me to unhook for him to let go in the water by that pole already.
customer_reviews.author: gw

customer_reviews.title: Great rod to keep in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a small phluger reel to go with this. I keep it under the back seat in my truck. Never know when you might find somewhere you want to cast a line. This is exactly what I've been looking for and works great for an awesome price. Definitely recomend.
customer_reviews.author: HauserHooch

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: So Far so good. I like the weight and it is perfect for small bluegill fishing. Will Update if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ackpfft

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy! I have had a graphite telescoping pole and it broke on a snag. However, this pole is fiberglass and much more durable. The eyelets will work with spinning gear or with casting gear. I'm very pleased with the portability and value.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I don't like the feel
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the feel.. I fish for panfish and trout and I don't find this as sensitive as I would like. However, It is 1/10th the price of a st croix travel rod.For me, since I have only a limited time to fish, I went the more sensitive rod and expensive rod, so I could maximize my catch in my limited time.
customer_reviews.author: gjmavro

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a lemon...... maybe just a poor product.
customer_reviews.text: Weight is good, feels good. But first the very first fish caught on it ( maybe 10 inch largemouth) snapped one third of the way down from the tip. I was very hopeful that this rod would end up being a wonderful addition. But nothing but disappointment..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just the thing for the car or canoe
customer_reviews.text: Great rods, and perfect for the car and the canoe. No more rods going everywhere! Have already caught a number of fish with them and they perform well. Used them with a light action reel and they were fine, although they feel more like medium action to me. But great for a wide range of fish.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it works.
customer_reviews.text: This pole did fine until the black plastic eyelet popped out of the end of the pole. It still fishes, the handle is kind of small for my hands, but it works. Just my crappie/bass pole. Something small.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: I like top end stuff and like to have my act ...
customer_reviews.text: My go to for ultralight kayak fishing. I like top end stuff and like to have my act together. Though this rod would not be considered "high end" it fits in with the rest of my kit very well. I used it all last season, caught many fish including 4-5lb catfish and it is in perfect shape. Plenty of backbone, I purchased another on for a gift and that person uses theirs most every day in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: love it! Bought one for my dad years ago. He loves it so I decided to buy one for myself as well. It's a medium, packs down very nicely. Casts well and handled fish nicely. Caught 7 small mouth in about 20mins! I definitely recommend this as a pack rod/river rod
customer_reviews.author: mason sferlazza

customer_reviews.title: If you travel or hike then fish -- this is ...
customer_reviews.text: If you travel or hike then fish -- this is the rod for you....we hiked in Colorado and I kept it geared up and would only have to extend it out take and cast into unfished pools....ready in about 1 minute....fish the pool then put it back to about 15 inches...into my daypack and back on the trail!!!! For the price you will not go wrong!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sink Creek Day Spa

customer_reviews.title: Great rod at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great rod at a great price. I keep it in my work car along with a small tackle box. It casts well and has caught anything from small panfish to larger 3 and 4 pound bass. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon would not let me return it because it passed the return date. I only used it three times and the top part broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay backup
customer_reviews.text: Keeping it only as a backup. I think it might have given me a fiberglass splinter, so I keep a watchful eye out. Can't prove that though... yet. I'm not exactly trying to though either. I don't like this particular style of fishing rod, the sections tend to get jammed.
customer_reviews.author: Divermartin

customer_reviews.title: Lethal Stealth Rod!
customer_reviews.text: Compact,easy to use , fits in a bucket used for a seat. Kept in my suv. Always ready to fish !
customer_reviews.author: Old One

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Not the lightest but not the most expensive either. Fits my needs well.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT G SUMMERS

customer_reviews.title: Gets Stuck
customer_reviews.text: The top segment got stuck in the extended position on the first use. As other reviews have said, this defeats the purpose of a telescoping rod. Furthermore, I snapped off an eyelet trying to get it unstuck.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our trip to Florida. Spent a week ocean fishing. Caught everything from snappers to sharks. Now I take one with me backpacking. I
customer_reviews.author: Ben heuser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little pack rod
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little pack rod, cheap, packs small and it'll be there when you need it unlike your high end rods you don't want to leave under the seat of your car. you'll laugh when you end up putting a nice reel that was 4x the cost of the rod on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Nice pole to throw in the razor for mountain fishing
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Took it hiking, and it travels very well. I didn't catch anything, but it seems to be very well made and durable. I plan to add it to my two other rods the next time I kayak fish.
customer_reviews.author: J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Eagle Claw Telescopic Reels - never will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These poles break easily and fish guides fall apart. Such a disappointing rod and I really like the Eagle Claw brand. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Stuck Rod
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in the winter as a Christmas present for my dad and when we went to use it for the first time this spring we were not able to collapse it after use. I tried hot water, WD40, and the thing still won't budge. The thing is stuck and I wish I had tested it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Faviola Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son tolk mine for his car, so I bought another one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice addition to my "hiking" pack. Nice for packing through brush and such.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little rod!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little rod! The fast action tip makes casting light baits easy. The fact that it collapses down to about 16 " makes it great for the kayak and hiking through the brush to get to the shoreline. Caught a 2 1\2 pound smallmouth with no problem. Perfect fit for my use.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love these poles.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my 5th pole, I have a pack with all of them and gear in it ,when the family and I go into the High lakes, they work perfect, the action is perfect for the 8 to 16 inch brook trout we catch. some of the poles I have are around 10 or 11 years old and used a lot, Great Poles
customer_reviews.author: Marvin R. Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Good backpacking rod
customer_reviews.text: Very good but the tips of these 3 rods that I own are a bit on the thin side. Wish it was a little heavier but for the price I can't complain too much
customer_reviews.author: RWFTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: they can break more easily than typical fiberglass pole
customer_reviews.text: they work very well for camping / kayaking. they can break more easily than typical fiberglass pole, which is to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: zc

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I use this rod for fishing off of my kayak and I have only a positive experience. Considering the price, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Vitaliy Baranyuk

customer_reviews.title: Decent rod, Great value
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I've had is on the last guide the plastic ring broke off beside that's I paired this with a cheap Shimano spinning reel and have caught bass,catfish and perch on this rod
customer_reviews.author: johnny LoVe

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I liked this so much, I bought another. One for bait fishing while I use the other for lure fishing. Light weight, compact. Great action.
customer_reviews.author: Mario J. Estioko

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one. First one has been everywhere with me. Eventually broke the tip. Repaired, and now I have two. Good for traveling...
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Snapped pretty quick.
customer_reviews.text: I hate writing negative reviews, but this rod just didn't cut the mustard. Thought It was a pretty nice rod to take hiking... until it snapped on the third or forth trip out. The action felt quite stiff too, but that's just what you get at this price, I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt_Time144

customer_reviews.title: nope not worth it
customer_reviews.text: broke right of the package trying to extent the rod. when I went to collapse the eye broke off. retuned for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Claudia R.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working one of the connections got stuck and would not fold down anymore. Didn't take long
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Classic
customer_reviews.text: Just like the one my father had. I enjoy the ease of taking it to where I want to fish.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its looks great. It is very light weight just exactly what I was looking for. Very happy 😃
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rivera

customer_reviews.title: ) and a lot of bluegill- so far so good and wouldn't hesitate to order another
customer_reviews.text: Used it several times, brought in a few bass ( 2 to 3 lbs.) and a lot of bluegill- so far so good and wouldn't hesitate to order another.
customer_reviews.author: MCP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked good on a vaca to mexico, left it with my waiter, made a new friend ;-0
customer_reviews.author: Ifishmo

customer_reviews.title: keep it in the glove box
customer_reviews.text: i have had this rod for about 3 years and keep it in my truck. works well with micro reels and also Zebco 33
customer_reviews.author: Uniform 37

customer_reviews.title: New Scoping with Fishing Telescope
customer_reviews.text: The fisherman who received this gift was really surprised and appreciated this new equipment to enhance his fishing. The rod was well packaged, had good directions, and was all it promised to be.
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Yarmuth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a canoe trip, easy to stow.
customer_reviews.text: I used the rod for a canoe trip in Canada and it worked perfectly. Easy to stow and landed quite a few nice bass, walleye and pike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pole, better price
customer_reviews.text: Fishing poles worked out very well for a backpacking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice telescoping rod but I wish it had a loop for the fishing hook to hook to.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: A little stiff
customer_reviews.text: its a little stiff for me but I don't go for big fish often, works well so far, only had it on 2 trips so far but the pole seems well built, i worry about the silver section caps that are just glued on tho, one looks like its not going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Conyers

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I fish small streams and of course they are tree lined. It was probably my third of fourth cast when I got hung up in tree branch. Rather than the line breaking, or the lure coming off, the rod snapped. I won't buy another.
customer_reviews.author: AZ-JR

customer_reviews.title: Great portable rod
customer_reviews.text: I used this for creek fishing. Very handy to carry in a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for the last minute fishing trip. Small enough to throw in a back pack or in your trunk. I mounted a Shimano reel with 8lb test and caught a 20'', 5 pound largemouth bass a few days ago. I even caught a big snapping turtle and was able to reel it in with no problem. Great rod, well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Xyz

customer_reviews.title: Love to use it but broke
customer_reviews.text: Took the rod out and it broke as I was trying to set it up. disappointed for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Mccue

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good for keeping in the car for that odd fishing opportunity Collapses fairly small and is easy to take along. Works well with South Bend Micro reels.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easily fits pretty much anywhere! I keep it under the seat of my truck for some impromptu fishing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Moon

customer_reviews.title: stayed in my trunk
customer_reviews.text: love this rod kept it in my trunk because every now and then when i got sick of sitting in traffic ill pull over on my way home from work to a random lake and cast off.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: This little rod does exactly what I wanted it to ...
customer_reviews.text: This little rod does exactly what I wanted it to do. I use it on my sailboat where I have little room for storage of a rod that doesn't telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Epps

customer_reviews.title: it's OK wish it was lighter action but it's
customer_reviews.text: it's OK wish it was lighter action but it's good
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Good portable rod
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this rod for over a year. I keep it in my car for "emergency fishing" situations. Has come in handy more than once. I also have used it when going hiking, and there is a chance to fish but I dont want to bring all my gear. Fits in my backpack well. In terms of portability, this is a five star. Do not expect great functionality - it is not very powerful, not great for casting, but I have landed several bass in the two pound range with no issues. I give it four stars for it's great portability and that it has not broken yet, about what I would expect from a travel type rod.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great rod
customer_reviews.text: Great rod for traveling. We are able to put it in the trunk of the camaro go fishing. Pulled in a 3.4lb trout with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Worked a little better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked a little better than I expected. Fits in carry-on luggage. Fits in day pack. Casted 1/4 oz lure just fine. Used on 4 to 5 hikes in Yellowstone
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Klein

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I extended this rod and tried to retract it the top portion got stuck and won't close. Totally defeats the purpose of a telescoping rod.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Freeman

customer_reviews.title: it opens very easily, but he's had a lot of problems getting ...
customer_reviews.text: it was an xmas gift . it opens very easily , but he's had a lot of problems getting it back to the fold up position
customer_reviews.author: woodrow171

customer_reviews.title: I caught 110+ walleye in 5 days and it held up great. Any freshwater fisherman should have this tucked away ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely impressed at the quality for the value. I caught 110+ walleye in 5 days and it held up great. Any freshwater fisherman should have this tucked away in their bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Huang

customer_reviews.title: Nice rod!
customer_reviews.text: Was a lil sceptical, I didn't see any telescopic rods with very good reviews. Glad I got this one, its compact but when fully extended its full size. Feels like its built well, nice flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: my husband loves this very versatile rod
customer_reviews.text: He used it in Patagonia..it fit in our medium size bag and would have fit in a carry on. He will use it from now on. Now...if only it would guarantee a fish, it would be a perfect rod !
customer_reviews.author: R. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great truck rod for compact storage. be good for a backpack
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have this rod setup with a micro pflueger spin ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this rod setup with a micro pflueger spin reel. It's tiny size has encouraged me to take my rod with me on enough extra occasions, that I have caught a lot of fish I wouldn't have otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Fisherman Dad
customer_reviews.text: My dad said as soon as the weather breaks he’s using it
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Woodard

customer_reviews.title: eagle claw
customer_reviews.text: the pole I received is great. My only complaint would be that if it is extended to tight it is extremely difficult to get back in. other than that is works great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Orth

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. It is not quite fishing season up here ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It is not quite fishing season up here yet but I cannot wait to use this little rod. It arrived ahead of schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Shena

customer_reviews.title: Great compact rod
customer_reviews.text: It collapses well, so it's great to use when camping when you don't want to lug alot around as far as space.
customer_reviews.author: OilsbyAmanda

customer_reviews.title: eagle claw rod
customer_reviews.text: Quality rod, just like normal rod when extended., and reel attachment is plastic like every other modern rod.
customer_reviews.author: Player

customer_reviews.title: Hikers take a look at this easy packing fishing rod.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, especially if the fish co-operate. Easily carried in a backpack during a National Park hiking trip.
customer_reviews.author: Busgate

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The rod broke while unsnagging on the first use. Rod looks good though. Packed in on ATV. Got snag and it broke
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk
customer_reviews.text: Ya sure it's cheap but even if it cost $5 that's still a waste of $5. First the top inserts fell out for like no reason. Super annoying but by bending the ring I was sort of able to keep it in place for maybe 20 minutes at a time. Then the shaft itself snapped about 2/3 way up the rod. I was using 4# line! Still got the perch ....but wat? How does that even happen. Save yourself the hassle and don't get this.
customer_reviews.author: MMSahler

customer_reviews.title: Good telescopic rod
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good rod for the price. I hate carrying a bunch of rods and having bought 2 of these it makes mobility a lot easier when fishing. My friends also liked the color which I like too.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy Compact Light Ugly color Buy one because it is a great price for any rod just to have around
customer_reviews.author: D. Ducharme

product_meta.title: Eagle Claw PK555SP Pack-It Telescopic Spinning Rod, 5-Feet x 6-Inch
